title: [BEAM-11277] Respect schemaUpdateOptions during BigQuery load with temporary tables
body:
The problem: [Schema update options](https://googleapis.dev/python/bigquery/2.10.0/generated/google.cloud.bigquery.job.SchemaUpdateOption.html) are not respected when using temporary tables to load data into BigQuery (e.g., when the number of files to load necessitate using multiple load jobs). Unlike when using query or load jobs, BigQuery does not allow field addition or relaxation when using copy jobs to append data to an existing table. The solution: Before starting the copy jobs to move data from temporary tables to the final destination table, run zero row load jobs against the destination table(s) using the temporary table schemas and user provided schema update options. These zero row load jobs will update (if needed) the schema of the destination table(s) to accept the data from the forthcoming copy jobs. If no schema update options are configured, then no zero-row load jobs will be run--`UpdateDestinationSchema` and `WaitForSchemaModJobs` become no-ops. Summary of changes: * (This PR is stacked on top of #14112) * Trigger zero-row load jobs against destination tables after successfully loading data into temporary tables and before triggering copy jobs. * Update `BigQueryWrapper.perform_load_jobs` to allow triggering load jobs using either a list of source URIs or a single file like object (for this PR the file like object is an empty file, or zero-row CSV file). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11884] Pass destination as str rather than TableReference within BigQueryBatchFileLoads
body:
I encountered the following error that appears to be caused by #13839 ``` TypeError: Unable to deterministically encode '' of type '', please provide a type hint for the input of 'WriteToBigQuery/BigQueryBatchFileLoads/GroupFilesByTableDestinations' [while running 'WriteToBigQuery/BigQueryBatchFileLoads/IdentityWorkaround'] ``` The outputs of `WriteRecordsToFile`, `WriteGroupedRecordsToFile`, and `TriggerLoadJobs` can contain `TableReference` which does not have a deterministic coder. The PR uses `bigquery_tools.get_hashable_destination` to create a string representation of `TableReference` so that it can be deterministically coded and used with `GroupByKey`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Attempting improvements on DirectRunner Python dash
body:
Updating charts for Python DirectRunner benchmarks. Sample image - note how both series are shown in a single chart. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1301740/109269429-53028680-77c1-11eb-9663-907ad2f3d70d.png) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11748] Fix PViewToIdMapper in Samza runner
body:
PValueBase.toString() now appends the hashcode to the end. This causes the PViewToIdMapper generates IDs with hashcode, which can be inconsistent in different Samza containers. And therefore causes runtime issues. We should exclude the hashcode from the id. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Do not stage dataflow worker jar when use runner_v2.
body:
r: @kennknowles ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Recognize JOB_STATE_PENDING from Dataflow and map to RUNNING
body:
Since adding the warning log about unrecognized states, I've seen that PENDING is not recognized. I mapped it to RUNNING since that is closest. Technically, both adding and removing enums could be a compatibility issue. It is an unfortunate API design. The `State` enum is both too detailed (having states that are not very generic) but also not detailed enough (not allowing runners to have runner-specific details because it is an enum not a type parameter). So my approach is to just put a band-aid on it and map states to their closest Beam state. Eventually, if we care, we might design a better API and deprecate this one. We could also just document something like "you have to have a `default` clause in your `switch` statements because we intend to add new enums". Probably most users are not actually looking at all these possible values. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11864] Use objects.equals instead of raw comparison
body:
The left hand side of the comparison can be equal as well. When registering multiple coders, it will produce a NPE when checking if the fromRowFunction is already registered: ``` [WARNING] java.lang.NullPointerException at org.apache.beam.sdk.schemas.utils.AvroUtils$RowToGenericRecordFn.equals (AvroUtils.java:559) at org.apache.beam.sdk.schemas.SchemaCoder.equals (SchemaCoder.java:208) at org.apache.beam.vendor.guava.v26_0_jre.com.google.common.base.Objects.equal (Objects.java:52) at org.apache.beam.vendor.guava.v26_0_jre.com.google.common.collect.HashBiMap.seekByKey (HashBiMap.java:224) at org.apache.beam.vendor.guava.v26_0_jre.com.google.common.collect.HashBiMap.get (HashBiMap.java:254) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.SdkComponents.registerCoder (SdkComponents.java:265) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PCollectionTranslation.toProto (PCollectionTranslation.java:35) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.SdkComponents.registerPCollection (SdkComponents.java:227) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PTransformTranslation.translateAppliedPTransform (PTransformTranslation.java:479) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PTransformTranslation$KnownTransformPayloadTranslator.translate (PTransformTranslation.java:424) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PTransformTranslation.toProto (PTransformTranslation.java:239) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.SdkComponents.registerPTransform (SdkComponents.java:175) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PipelineTranslation$1.visitPrimitiveTransform (PipelineTranslation.java:87) at org.apache.beam.sdk.runners.TransformHierarchy$Node.visit (TransformHierarchy.java:587) at org.apache.beam.sdk.runners.TransformHierarchy$Node.visit (TransformHierarchy.java:579) at org.apache.beam.sdk.runners.TransformHierarchy$Node.access$500 (TransformHierarchy.java:239) at org.apache.beam.sdk.runners.TransformHierarchy.visit (TransformHierarchy.java:213) at org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline.traverseTopologically (Pipeline.java:468) at org.apache.beam.runners.core.construction.PipelineTranslation.toProto (PipelineTranslation.java:59) at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.DataflowRunner.run (DataflowRunner.java:933) at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.DataflowRunner.run (DataflowRunner.java:196) at org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline.run (Pipeline.java:322) at ....PubsubToBigQuery.main (PubsubToBigQuery.java:98) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0 (Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:498) at org.codehaus.mojo.exec.ExecJavaMojo$1.run (ExecJavaMojo.java:282) at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:748) ``` This is because when you register a GenericRecord, the schema will be null, resulting in the NPE above. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (R: @iemejia). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-11864] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-11864` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11861] Add methods to explicitly provide coder for ParquetIO's Parse and ParseFiles
body:
Provide setCoder, withCoder methods in ParquetIO.Parse and ParquetIO.ParseFiles to provide explicit coder. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @theneuralbit`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Cleaning up unused CombiningTriggerDriver
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11860] Fix preview links for capability matrix detail views

title: Always use portable job submission for Dataflow V2
body:
There are some limitations to this, but I think it would be good to commit to it early and accept the regressions instead of trying to support multiple ways of submitting the job. Opening this to start collecting the tests and categories that need to be excluded or debugged. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10708] Support Deepcopy of Pipeline instances
body:
1. Added deepcopy copier implementation to Pipeline, AppliedPTransform, PCollection and PTransform classes in Python SDK. 2. Added a copy_pipeline util to switch between runner-api-roundtrip and new deepcopy implementation based on whether the pipeline contains an ExternalTransform. We'll gradually move away from the roundtrip solution once the deepcopy solution is stable. 3. Encapsulated the derivation tracking inside the copy_pipeline util. 4. Early adopted the copy_pipeline util in pipeline_fragment and pipeline_instrument. Further changes are still needed to support ExternalTransforms with InteractiveRunner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Merge Fn API and runner v2 configurations for DataflowRunner
body:
Makes the DataflowRunner detect any runner v2 or beam_fn_api flag and treat them all the same. They only needed to be separate when we used the JRH, which we do not. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Log a warning when Dataflow returns an unrecognized state
body:
We've seen a number of cases of "job terminate in state UNRECOGNIZED but did not return a failure reason". This will make it easy to notice what the unrecognized state is. The risk is that it could create a lot of logging, but that should be limited to the polling in waiting for a job to finish. Whenever the Dataflow service creates a new state, it will be unrecognized by past SDKs, so this log line _will_ produce warnings for users of past SDKs in this scenario. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11868] Make Python GroupByKey convert AfterProcessingTime to AfterSynchronizedProcessingTime
body:
Per dev list thread at https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf1df50cb1da7a93a693806298f7e2f73fa9f93566a7b66819c269be4%40%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E Make Python match Java: continuation trigger for "after processing time" should be "after synchronized processing time". Separately, we have agreed that runners can do whatever they want with this trigger. They don't have to actually run it, but can go ahead and just always trigger. Then we can adjust the SDK or not, or wait until it is convenient, etc. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10937] Tour of Beam: Reading and writing data notebook
body:
This is the second introductory notebook on how to read and write data. It covers: * Basic I/O concepts * `ReadFromText` and `WriteToText` transforms * Creating new sources * Creating data from generators * Reading data from SQLite * Creating new sinks * Writing fixed-sized batches * Writing windows of elements R: @aaltay R: @rosetn Staged: * New notebook: https://colab.research.google.com/github/davidcavazos/beam/blob/tour-of-beam-reading-writing-data/examples/notebooks/tour-of-beam/reading-and-writing-data.ipynb * Updated "What's next" section: https://colab.research.google.com/github/davidcavazos/beam/blob/tour-of-beam-reading-writing-data/examples/notebooks/tour-of-beam/getting-started.ipynb * Added new entry: http://apache-beam-website-pull-requests.storage.googleapis.com/14045/get-started/tour-of-beam/index.html > Note: I tried reading from public Cloud Storage data and public BigQuery data, but they all required authentication, so I decided to not include them. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11867] Remove use of model SYNCHRONIZED_PROCESSING_TIME

title: [BEAM-11852] Update the title of our use-case on the new Beam Website
body:
Update the title of our use-case on the new Beam Website I think the title used for our use-case could be improved by making it more Beam-centric. From "Four Apache Technologies Combined for Fun and Profit" to "Combining the Power of Beam With Three Other Apache Technologies for Fun and Profit" should we also add the YouTube video underneath? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Minor bugfix in typecoders.FirstOf.
body:
Coder.from_type_hint should be passed a CoderRegistry as the second argument. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11796] Fix website build

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11344] Apply "Become a Committer" changes from Website Revamp

title: Returning successful writes in FhirIO.Write.Result
body:
Adding a getSuccesses() method to the FhirIO.Write.Result - useful for the healthcare API users to know which bodies were successfully written to the store. I also made the check for TupleTags consistent in FhirIO.Read.Result and FhirIO.Search.Result (using the PCollectionTuple .has() method) since the cast from TupleTagList -> java.util.Collection resulted in a ClassCastException for me. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11408, BEAM-11772] Integrate Python BigQuery sink with GroupIntoBatches
body:
This is a parity of Java changes (#13496 and #13859). Use `GroupIntoBatches.WithShardedKey` API to group and batch write before streaming to BigQuery service. Currently batching is done best-effort upon bundle finalization. This PR adds an option to `WriteToBigQuery` to toggle between the existing and new implementation for both streaming inserts and file loads. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11415] Adding ValidatesRunner w/ Python ULR tests to Go Precommit
body:
Pretty straightforward. The only weird part is that I couldn't figure out if it's possible to add a "flag" of sorts to a task. So in this case, I needed to make a separate ULR ValidatesRunner task just to add the --jenkins flag to the script call. As a side note, it may be time soon to remove the previous integration test code. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11227] Preparing vendored gRPC upgrade from 1.26 to 1.35
body:
This PR prepares the vendored gRPC version upgrade from 1.26 to 1.35 # Todo - See how this new version breaks compilation. It compiled how about tests? - It compiled without changing code manually. Tests have passed except Java PostCommit that has been failing since Feb 27th. (-> sent a mail) - With [this hack](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14028/files#diff-c0dfa6bc7a8685217f70a860145fbdf416d449eaff052fa28352c5cec1a98c06R344), the pull request checks can run against the vendored gRPC 1.36.0 without publishing it to Maven Central. - Have a release manager to publish the vendored gRPC 1.36.0 (http://s.apache.org/beam-release-vendored-artifacts) with votes in dev@beam.apache. - Fix anything that fails with the vendored gRPC 1.36.0 - Remove the directory for the old gRPC 1.26.0 - Merge this PR. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11227] Upgrading vendored gRPC from 1.26 to 1.35
body:
Attempt to see where it breaks when upgrading the vendored gRPC from 1.26 to 1.35. The first step in https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/vendor/README.md: ``` # Vendored Dependencies Release The upgrading of the vendored dependencies should be performed in two steps: - Firstly, we need to perform a formal release of the vendored dependency. The [release process](http://s.apache.org/beam-release-vendored-artifacts) of the vendored dependency is separate from the release of Apache Beam. - When the release of the vendored dependency is out, we can migrate Apache Beam to use the newly released vendored dependency. ``` The command below is in the vendor/README.md, but it failed because `sdks/java/core` module cannot compile: ``` ./gradlew -PvendoredDependenciesOnly -Ppublishing -PjavaLinkageArtifactIds=beam-vendor-grpc-1_26_0:0.1-SNAPSHOT :checkJavaLinkage ``` Previous upgrade: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10578/files. (This seems that the PR was created **after** the new version of the vendored gRPC was released) Next step? https://s.apache.org/beam-release-vendored-artifacts ? **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Add null checks to FhirIO.Search for when the search results are empty.
body:
When the search result returned from FhirIO.Search is empty, the following exception occurs: ``` Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at com.google.gson.JsonArray.addAll (JsonArray.java:117) at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.healthcare.FhirIO$Search$SearchResourcesJsonString$SearchResourcesFn.searchResources (FhirIO.java:1695) at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.healthcare.FhirIO$Search$SearchResourcesJsonString$SearchResourcesFn.processElement (FhirIO.java:1662) ``` Changed the first "addAll" to be within the "while hasNext" loop, and fixed "hasNext" to also check for null, as this causes: ``` Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.healthcare.HttpHealthcareApiClient$FhirResourcePages$FhirResourcePagesIterator.hasNext(HttpHealthcareApiClient.java:964) at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.healthcare.FhirIO$Search$SearchResourcesJsonString$SearchResourcesFn.searchResources(FhirIO.java:1688) at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.healthcare.FhirIO$Search$SearchResourcesJsonString$SearchResourcesFn.processElement(FhirIO.java:1655) ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11791] Fixing FnApiRunner Microbenchmarks to export to influxDB
body:
Restructuring the file to copy `job_LoadTests_Combine_Python.groovy` The reason influxdb export was not working is that we were not adding additionalPipelineOptions to the job options, and thus the export did not include the InfluxDB instance. See [sample run logs](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_Python_LoadTests_FnApiRunner_Microbenchmark/31/consoleFull) are missing influx_db_host: ``` 00:00:27.176 [src] $ /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_Python_LoadTests_FnApiRunner_Microbenchmark/src/gradlew -PloadTest.mainClass=apache_beam.testing.load_tests.microbenchmarks_test -Prunner=DirectRunner -PwithDataflowWorkerJar=false "-PloadTest.args=--publish_to_big_query=true --influx_measurement=python_microbenchmarks --project=apache-beam-testing --metrics_dataset=load_test --metrics_table=python_direct_microbenchmarks --input_options='{}' --runner=DirectRunner" -PpythonVersion=3.7 --continue --max-****s=12 -Dorg.gradle.jvmargs=-Xms2g -Dorg.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4g -Pdocker-pull-licenses :sdks:python:apache_beam:testing:load_tests:run ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Enable SideInput metrics for DF worker. These have been launched.
body:
I'm clening up experiments, as these have been perma-enabled for a while. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11659] Allow Kafka sql table provider to have a nested mode and raw binary payloads
body:
This modifies the Kafka sql table provider to have a nested mode like Pub/Sub currently does, that exposes the headers and event timestamp from the record. It also allows the payload field in this mode to be BYTES type, remaining unparsed in this case. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11850] Add DDL support to SQL Transform
body:
This is a simple answer to the question: "How do I use beam SQL in Java", which does not currently exist outside of "impl" packages. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
